VERY STRONG DEEP LAYER SHEAR FAVORABLE FOR TORNADIC SUPERCELLS IN PLACE WITH APPROACH OF VIGOROUS UPPER TROUGH.  INCREASING THREAT FOR TORNADOES ALONG/AHEAD OF SQUALL LINE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS.

DISCUSSION...COMPLEX SQUALL LINE WITH EMBEDDED SUPERCELL/LEWP STRUCTURES WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EWD FROM MS INTO AL THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS.  WEAK SURFACE BASED INSTABILITY PERSISTS S OF A WARM FRONT ACROSS NRN AL...WHILE THE STRONGEST PRESSURE FALLS AND FORCING FOR ASCENT ARE BEGINNING TO SPREAD NEWD FROM NE MS/NW AL TOWARD TN.  EXPECT THE SQUALL LINE TO MAINTAIN INTENSITY FOR A FEW MORE HOURS WITH THE THREAT FOR DAMAGING WINDS WITH EMBEDDED BOWING SEGMENTS.  ADDITIONALLY...THE VERY STRONG LOW-LEVEL SHEAR MAY SUPPORT A COUPLE OF TORNADOES...ESPECIALLY NEAR THE WARM FRONT ACROSS NWRN/NRN AL BEFORE LOW-LEVEL SHEAR BEGINS TO WEAKEN AFTER SUNRISE.

DISCUSSION...ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE SYSTEM/SURFACE MESOLOW APPEARS TO HAVE FORMED ALONG THE SURFACE WARM FRONT BETWEEN JAN AND MEI.  THE WARM FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO LIFT NWD ACROSS CENTRAL AL...WHICH WILL MARK THE LIKELY PATH OF THE MESOLOW INTO CENTRAL AL.  BOUNDARY LAYER DEWPOINTS OF 65-68 F WILL SUPPORT SBCAPE VALUES OF 500-1000 J/KG ALONG AND S OF THE WARM FRONT...AND LOW-LEVEL SHEAR WILL BE MAXIMIZED ALONG THIS BOUNDARY. A FEW TORNADOES AND DAMAGING WIND GUSTS WILL BE THE MAIN SEVERE THREATS WITH COMPLEX SUPERCELL/BOW ECHO STRUCTURES.

DISCUSSION...LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE AL/GA BORDER WILL TRACK EASTWARD THROUGH THE AFTERNOON ACROSS THE WW AREA.  BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS...DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 60S...AND STRONG WIND FIELDS WILL PROMOTE A RISK OF DAMAGING WINDS IN STRONGER CELLS.

DISCUSSION...CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE INCREASING AHEAD OF STRONG SHORTWAVE TROUGH NOW APPROACHING THE SRN APPALACHIANS...WITH STORMS SPREADING ENEWD ACROSS CENTRAL SC BY LATER TONIGHT.  AIR MASS IS MARGINALLY TO MODERATELY UNSTABLE ALONG AND SOUTH OF A STATIONARY FRONT EXTENDING FROM NEAR ATL TO NEAR GSB...WHICH WILL LIKELY FOCUS SEVERE THUNDERSTORM THREAT.  00Z SOUNDING AND AREA VWPS INDICATE PRONOUNCED SHEAR AND LOW LCLS SUGGESTING STRONGER STORMS WILL LIKELY BECOME SUPERCELLULAR OR EVOLVE INTO SMALL BOW ECHOES WITH ATTENDANT THREATS OF A FEW TORNADOES AND DAMAGING WINDS.

DISCUSSION...INCREASING LARGE SCALE ASCENT IS SUPPORTING STRENGTHENING THUNDERSTORMS OVER SWRN GA/FAR SERN AL LATE THIS EVENING.  INSTABILITY AND SHEAR PARAMETERS REMAIN VERY FAVORABLE FOR SUPERCELLS AND TORNADOES SHOULD STORMS ROOT DEEPLY INTO A VERY MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER AS ACTIVITY DEVELOPS ENEWD OVERNIGHT.

DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS...INCLUDING A FEW LONG-LIVED SUPERCELLS...EXPECTED TO CONTINUE SPREADING ENE ACROSS THE S ATLANTIC CSTL PLN LATER THIS MORNING AS 80+ KT SWLY MID LEVEL SPEED MAX APPROACHES REGION FROM THE SW.  QUALITY OF BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE INFLOW AND LENGTH OF HODOGRAPHS SUGGEST POTENTIAL FOR TORNADOES DESPITE SOMEWHAT VEERED NEAR-SURFACE FLOW.

DISCUSSION...THUNDERSTORMS/SUPERCELLS DEVELOPING UPSTREAM ACROSS NRN SC EXPECTED TO MOVE/DEVELOP NEWD INTO PARTS OF NC DURING THE NEXT FEW HOURS... WHERE AMPLE SHEAR WILL BE PRESENT FOR SUSTAINED ACTIVITY.  OTHER SUPERCELLS MAY EVOLVE FROM CONFLUENCE/LOW LEVEL WARM ADVECTION BAND OVER EXTREME ERN NC.  DEEP SHEAR SHOULD CONTINUE TO INCREASE ACROSS REGION THIS MORNING AS 80+ KT MID LEVEL SPEED MAX CONTINUES NEWD FROM THE SRN APPALACHIANS.  STRONGEST ACTIVITY SHOULD BE CONFINED TO REGION ALONG QUASISTATIONARY FRONT FROM S CNTRL NC NEWD INTO SE VA.

DISCUSSION...DEEPENING SURFACE LOW MOVING NEWD INTO SWRN MS WITH WARM SECTOR ACROSS SERN LA/SRN MS BECOMING SUFFICIENTLY UNSTABLE TO SUPPORT SUPERCELL/TORNADO POTENTIAL.  VERY STRONG SHEAR PROFILES IN PLACE AS UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS ERN TX FOR ROTATING STORMS ALONG AND AHEAD OF STRONG COLD FRONT AND DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW.  LOW WILL TRACK NEWD ACROSS SRN MS INTO W CENTRAL AL BY LATER THIS EVENING.

DISCUSSION...CHANCE FOR ISOLATED TORNADOES WILL EXIST THIS EVENING OVER A SMALL PART OF THE CNTRL GULF CST REGION AS SHALLOW WARM FRONT LIFTS NWD FROM THE NRN GULF.  AMPLE DEEP /60+ KTS/ AND LOW LEVEL SHEAR /50 KTS/ EXPECTED FOR SUSTAINED LOW TO MID LEVEL STORM ROTATION GIVEN CONTINUED ENE MOTION OF 80+ KT MID LEVEL SPEED MAX OVER E TX.
